home.missionText1: Rivemont's mission is to offer personalized and innovative portfolio management, aligned with each investor's unique goals.
home.missionText2: We focus on active and disciplined management, with the aim of optimizing performance while minimizing risk.
home.missionText3: Our goal is to build lasting, successful partnerships based on rigour, ethics, and transparency.

who.title: To whom is private wealth intended for?
who.text1: Private wealth management is intended for clients with assets of more than $250,000 to invest who are looking for a complete and performing solution.
clients: Holders of registered accounts (LIRA, RRSP, TFSA)
who.offeringTitle: The private wealth offering at Rivemont provides you with:
offering: Portfolio aligned to a precise investment policy
Access to an external multidisciplinary team able to help you with all your financial needs, such as financial planning, tax planning and accounting, etc.
who.text2: Please do not hesitate to contact us so that we can assess your financial situation and recommend a personalized solution which reflects both your needs and investment goals.

cycle.title: Management Cycle
cycle.text: Our cycle of management is a structured approach designed to optimize your investment experience:
steps: Initial assessment: Understanding your financial goals, risk tolerance and investment horizon
Strategy development: Creation of a personalized investment policy
Implementation: Execution of the investment strategy with precision
Monitoring: Continuous tracking of portfolio performance
Rebalancing: Regular adjustments to maintain optimal allocation
Reporting: Detailed monthly statements and performance reviews

philosophy.title: Our Investment Philosophy
philosophy.text1: At Rivemont, we believe that the price of an asset is not always equal to its intrinsic value since the price is influenced by several factors, including several cognitive biases on the part of investors.
philosophy.text2: Since these biases are known, and repeat themselves over time, it is possible to make investment decisions based on these recurring behaviors.
philosophy.text3: We rely on momentum-based strategies including technical analysis and trend monitoring. The manager uses a top-down approach by establishing first which sectors have the highest growth potential to subsequently, within these identified sectors, to select specific securities.

methodology.title: Our Investment Methodology
methodology.text: Our investment methodology combines rigorous analysis with disciplined execution:
points: Macro-economic analysis to identify market trends
Sector rotation based on momentum indicators
Technical analysis for entry and exit points

strategies.title: Investment Strategies
strategies.text: We offer various investment strategies adapted to different client profiles:
list: Growth strategy: Focus on capital appreciation
Balanced strategy: Mix of growth and income-producing assets
Conservative strategy: Focus on capital preservation
Alternative strategies: Access to our specialized funds

why.title: Why Rivemont?

cfa.title: Why choose a CFA Charterholder*?
cfa.text: The CFA (Chartered Financial Analyst) designation is the reference in portfolio management. Here's why choosing an advisor holding the CFA* designation is important:

Commitment to the highest professional standards
Adherence to a strict code of ethics

performance.title: Performance
performance.descriptionText: At Rivemont, we believe that the price of an asset is not always equal to its intrinsic value since the price is influenced by several factors, including several cognitive biases on the part of investors. Since these biases are known, and repeat themselves over time, it is possible to make investment decisions based on these recurring behaviors. We rely on momentum-based strategies including technical analysis and trend monitoring. The manager uses a top-down approach by establishing first which sectors have the highest growth potential to subsequently, within these identified sectors, to select specific securities.
performance.investmentObjectiveText: The investment objective of the equity asset class is to generate a higher return than its benchmark.
performance.explanatoryNotesText: Returns are from the composite of all equities held by the private wealth clients of Rivemont under representative code Q2F2 and are gross of fees. Before January 1, 2019, the benchmark is made up of 100% of the S&P/TSX Composite Index and, thereafter, of 80% of the S&P/TSX Composite Index and 20% of the S&P 500 Index. Future investment results will differ from past results. This document does not constitute a recommendation nor an investment advice and is presented for information purposes only.
performance.managerText: Martin Lalonde, MBA, CFA, is the portfolio manager responsible for the investment decisions. He has many years of experience in the financial markets and held, before founding Rivemont Investments, the position of senior analyst, investment, mergers and acquisitions for a major Canadian agency.
performance.aboutRivemontText: Founded in 2010, Rivemont is a portfolio management firm with around $153 million in assets under management. The firm offers performing investment strategies to a private wealth clientele, brokers, consultants and financial planners.

governance.title: Governance
governance.registrationText: Rivemont is registered as a portfolio manager in Quebec, Ontario, British Columbia, Alberta, Saskatchewan, Manitoba and New Brunswick, as an investment fund manager in Quebec and Ontario, as a derivatives portfolio manager in Quebec, as an exempt market dealer in Quebec, Ontario, Saskatchewan, Manitoba and New Brunswick and as a financial planner in Quebec.
governance.registerLink: Register of firms and individuals authorized to practice
governance.assetProtectionText1: The client portfolios are managed by Rivemont but held in accounts at National Bank of Canada, more specifically with a divison called the National Bank Independent Network (NBIN).
governance.assetProtectionText2: NBIN is a financial institution that administers assets of more than $200 billion and is a member of the Canadian Investor Protection Fund. That fund protects your assets to a maximum $1,000,000 (and more in certain cases) in the very unlikely possibility of an insolvency of the financial institution.
governance.assetProtectionText3: By virtue of its mandate, Rivemont transmit instructions to NBIN to buy and sell securities within your account, but in no circumstances Rivemont have access to the assets held in your account.
governance.privacyPolicyText1: In order to comply with the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act ("PIPEDA") and the Act respecting the protection of personal information in the private sector (Quebec), Rivemont has implemented a privacy policy.
governance.privacyPolicyText2: Martin Lalonde, Chief Compliance Officer at Rivemont, is the person responsible for the protection of personal information.
governance.complaintHandling: Complaint Handling and Dispute Resolution Policy
governance.complaintHandlingText: We are committed to ensuring that every complaint is addressed promptly, fairly, and transparently. Our goal is to effectively resolve the issues that are causing your concerns.
